metadata.sermon_start_end: Ich will nicht auf das ganze Hohelied der Liebe eingehen, sondern nur einen Vers herausgreifen. »Sie verträgt alles, sie glaubt alles, sie hofft alles, sie duldet alles.« Ist das möglich? Ist das nicht diese bodenlose Überforderung, die das Christentum so unlebbar macht und so hilflos? [...] Vereinigung ist das Gesetz des Ganzen, sie zu leben ist unser tiefstes Bedürfnis.

1_specific_bible_passage.findings: While the preacher selects a specific verse (1 Cor 13:7), the text is used as a springboard for a general philosophy of eroticism rather than being recreated as a proclamatory word of God. The 'specificity' Dekker demands—what is here that is nowhere else—is replaced by a general human experience of 'the great All'.
quotes: Ich will nicht auf das ganze Hohelied der Liebe eingehen, sondern nur einen Vers herausgreifen.
1_specific_bible_passage.improvement_point: Identify the specific theological weight of 'panta' (all things) in the context of Christ's love rather than interpreting it through the lens of William Blake or general human desire.

2_exegesis_original_context.findings: There is no evidence of Greek/Hebrew study or historical-critical engagement. The preacher ignores the context of the Corinthian congregation's strife and Paul's specific intent, substituting it with a critique of church history and sexism.
quotes: Die radikale Entgegensetzung von Eros und Agape ist einer der peinlichsten, trübsten und katastrophalsten Züge im Christentum
2_exegesis_original_context.improvement_point: Engage with the original meaning of 'Agape' in the Pauline corpus and the specific communal problems in Corinth that necessitated this description of love.

3_application_concrete_contemporary.findings: The application is contemporary in its focus on gender relations and eroticism, but it remains largely abstract and philosophical. It speaks of 'eroticizing the whole of life' without concrete ethical direction for the congregation's daily life.
quotes: Das Wort GOTT ist eine Vokabel, um diese Erotisierung des Ganzen auszudrücken.
3_application_concrete_contemporary.improvement_point: Move beyond the 'zeitgeist' of sexual liberation toward concrete examples of how this 'all-bearing' love manifests in modern social or political friction.

4_interwoveness_exposition_application.findings: Exposition is almost entirely absent, so interwovenness is impossible. The text is mentioned at the start and then largely abandoned in favor of a lecture on the history of ideas and psychology.
quotes: ...der Text enthält eine grenzensprengende Unvernunft, in die wir hineingezogen werden.
4_interwoveness_exposition_application.improvement_point: The hearer should be 'expounded' through the text; the preacher must let the biblical words drive the psychological insights, not vice versa.

5_three_parts_misery_redemption_gratitud.findings: Misery is identified as 'fragmentation' and 'sexism,' but it is not misery 'before God' (sin). Redemption is seen as an 'extension of eroticism' rather than a work of Christ. Gratitude is reduced to a 'deepest need' for union.
quotes: Die Ganzheit der Erfahrung »Liebe« wird zerstückelt
Vereinigung ist das Gesetz des Ganzen, sie zu leben ist unser tiefstes Bedürfnis.
5_three_parts_misery_redemption_gratitud.improvement_point: Reframe the 'misery' as the human inability to love as Paul describes, which requires a redemption found outside the self (extra nos).

6_two_ways_seriousness_of_choice.findings: This is entirely absent. There is no sense of being lost or the seriousness of God's judgment. The tone is one of inevitable progression toward 'union' as a 'law of the whole'.
quotes: So soll es sein, so wird es sein.
6_two_ways_seriousness_of_choice.improvement_point: Address the possibility of 'temporal loss'—the failure to answer God's call to love—to take the hearer's life design seriously.

7_christocentric_grace.findings: Christ is mentioned as a source of a 'message,' but He is not the telos. The sermon is more 'Eros-centric' than Christocentric. Grace is replaced by a natural capacity for love triggered by 'successful relationships'.
quotes: was in der Botschaft Jesu steckt
Ich habe mich kennengelernt als jemanden, der zu dem großen Alles fähig war, weil ihm das große Alles entgegenkam.
7_christocentric_grace.improvement_point: Present Christ not just as a teacher of love, but as the one who alone 'bears all things' and in whom the hearer finds life outside themselves.

8_depth_and_length.findings: At approximately 450 words, this text is a short meditation or 'impulse,' not a sermon. It lacks the 'breadth' required for theological depth according to Dekker's 20-minute minimum.
8_depth_and_length.improvement_point: Expand the systematic theological reflection and the exegetical grounding to reach the necessary 20-minute threshold.

overall_assessment.summary: The text fails to meet the formal and substantive requirements of a sermon as defined by Dekker. It lacks exegesis, is far too short, and replaces the proclamatory Word of God with a psychological-philosophical discourse on eroticism. The 'seriousness of the two ways' is ignored in favor of a quasi-universalist law of union.
strengths: The preacher attempts to bridge the gap between sacred and secular love (Agape/Eros), which shows an awareness of the 'zeitgeist'.
The language is direct and avoids 'churchy' clichés.
weaknesses: Total absence of original context or linguistic exegesis.
Insufficient length to develop any substantive theological depth.
Anthropocentric focus: God is reduced to a 'vocation' or 'term' for human experience.
Lack of the 'extra nos' (outside ourselves) element of salvation.
overall_assessment.final_judgment_according_to_dekker: This is not a sermon; it is a brief religious speech or 'table talk'. It fails the bicycle mechanic test: the wheel of the Word is not mounted to the frame of the congregation's reality through the specific scriptural text.
